questions.question: Identify the coefficient of price-elasticity of demand when the percentage increase in the quantity of a commodity demanded is smaller than the percentage fall in its price.
questions.explanation: If quantity demanded increases by a smaller percentage than the percentage fall in price, demand is inelastic, so elasticity coefficient is less than 1 (in absolute value).

questions.question: The “Point of inflection” comes in which stage of the law of variable proportions?
questions.explanation: Stage I (increasing returns) is where TP increases at an increasing rate initially, then at a decreasing rate after the point of inflection (where MP is maximum).

questions.question: The elasticity of demand of durable goods is:
questions.explanation: Durable goods (e.g., cars, appliances) typically have elastic demand (greater than 1) because they are postponable and often have substitutes.
